channel.title: Pages on 你好！Hello！Hallo！Bonjour！
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on 你好！Hello！Hallo！Bonjour！

item.description: my_randsvd() The MATLAB builtin function gallery('randsvd') can only generate random matrix or symmetric positive definite matrix. However, usually we need to test our algorithms for symmetric matrix. Although you can get symmetric matrix by A = randn(n); A = A + A';, it would be nice to inherit the features from gallery('randsvd'), such as control the singular values distributions. The following code achieves such desire by artificially introducing negative signs into the eigenvalues of the symmetric positive definite matrix generated by gallery('randsvd').
